person.persName: James H. Holloway (Colonel of the 48th Enrolled Militia and Eighth Kentucky Cavalry)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer, merchant, and soldier. Educated at the Henderson Seminary. Lived in Henderson County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Mollie Elliott Williams Holloway, daughter of John S. "Cerro Gordo" Williams. Worked as a merchant at Holloway & Company with his father from 1854 to 1861. Served as captain of Captain James H. Holloway's Company for ten days in September 1861, to guard Lock No. 1 on the Green River. Member and elder of the Presbyterian Church. Served as a captain in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (Co. K) from January 1862 to June 1862. Served as a major with the 8th Kentucky Cavalry from September 1862 to January 1863 . Promoted to lieutenant colonel of the 8th Kentucky Cavalry from January 1863 to September 1863. Served as colonel of the 48th Enrolled Militia, resigning in April 1864. Moved to Clark County, Kentucky in 1865.
